identificationModule.briefTitle: First-in-man Trial Evaluating the Safety and Efficacy of the NOVA Intracranial Stent (NOVA Trial)
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Prospective, Multi-center, Randomized Controlled Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of the NOVA Sirolimus Eluting Stent Versus the Apollo Stent

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Prospective, multi-center, randomized 1:1 single blind trial using NOVA sirolimus eluting stent versus Apollo bare metal stent conducted in approximately 15 interventional neurology centers in China. The study was sponsored by Sino Medical Sciences Technology Inc.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The study will enroll 264 subjects overall in two groups (randomized 1:1). The study follow-up will occur at 1, 6 and 12 months post-stent implantation. All patients will undergo angiography assessment (DSA/CTA) at 12 months follow-up. Angiography assessment will be performed at baseline (pre- and post-procedure) and 12 months follow-up.

armGroups.label: Experimental
armGroups.description: NOVA Intracranial sirolimus eluting stent system
interventionNames: Device: NOVA Intracranial Sirolimus Eluting Stent System

interventions.name: NOVA Intracranial Sirolimus Eluting Stent System
interventions.description: A sirolimus eluting intracranial stent system with polylactic-co-glycolic acid (PLGA) biodegradable drug carrier and electro-grated polybutyl methacrylate (PBMA) base coating. The stent platform is made of 316L stainless steel.

interventions.name: Apollo Intracranial Stent System
interventions.description: A 316L stainless steel balloon-expandable intracranial stent system

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Target vessel stroke or death events
Recurrent ischemic stroke in the involved vascular area
Cerebral parenchyma hemorrhage, subarachnoid hemorrhage and intraventricular bleeding events
National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) evaluation
